isometricviewv2

Class InfoLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • isometricviewv2.InfoLog

  • public class InfoLog
extends java.lang.Object
    OVERVIEW: This class allows the writing of critical debugging information onto the information log, the tiles and at the bottom of the screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InfoLog(Map map, Entity player)
      REQUIRES: a map to be grabbing data from and a player to use as the center of focus for debugging (x, y, z)-coordinates, type of tile, etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawLog(java.awt.Graphics g, javax.swing.JPanel p)
      REQUIRES: graphics context and a jPanel to draw the log onto.
      void updateLog(long currentTime)
      REQUIRES: the exact time in nanoseconds when the beginning of the current frame started.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • InfoLog

        public InfoLog(Map map,
               Entity player)
        REQUIRES: a map to be grabbing data from and a player to use as the center of focus for debugging (x, y, z)-coordinates, type of tile, etc. EFFECTS: initializes both of the above variables as well as does some preliminary work that needs to be done before functions are called.
        Parameters:
        map - information is retrieved from this instance of Map
        player - information is retrieved from this instance of Entity

    • Method Detail

      • drawLog

        public void drawLog(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    javax.swing.JPanel p)
        REQUIRES: graphics context and a jPanel to draw the log onto. EFFECTS: draws a transparent rectangle to the top corner of the screen, then draws relevant information in the box, on tiles and below the tiles if requested by the user (by pressing X.) MODIFIES: the jPanel is drawn on by the graphics context g. That specific frame is changed permanently.
        Parameters:
        g - a graphics context to print strings and the box outline with
        p - a jPanel to draw on

      • updateLog

        public void updateLog(long currentTime)
        REQUIRES: the exact time in nanoseconds when the beginning of the current frame started. EFFECTS: every 60 frames (roughly one second, though slightly longer) the string "fps" is updated with the current frames per second. Every single frame, the other strings are updated with (x, y, z)- coordinates, tile type and tile height.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - the current time in nanoseconds
